metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29424 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: The Net::Netmask module before 2.0000 for Perl does not properly considerextraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP address string, which(in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that isbased on IP addresses.

criterions.comment: libnet-netmask-perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libnetwork-ipv4addr-perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
